Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single to give the Phillies a 7-6 win.
Mark Vientos hit a pair of two-run homers, including one to tie the game in the ninth inning.
Bryson Stott hit a two-run triple in the bottom of the eighth to put the Phillies on top.
JT Realmuto's infield dribbler increased the Phillies' lead in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Luis Severino is slated to start for the Mets against Phillies lefty Cristopher Sánchez in Game 2.
The Mets right-hander won Game 1 of the NL Wild Card Series, allowing four runs over six innings against the Brewers.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza stated that the Mets will be ready for Game 3 at home after the heartbreaker.
Nick Castellanos delivered for the Phillies with two outs and two strikes in the ninth, giving Philadelphia a dramatic win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series is tied 1-1 and going back to Queens in what has been a wild NLDS.
